title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: £ 4m for new children 's services trust in the county .
northants to begin t20 title defence .

documents.title: man utd 's poole loaned to cobblers
text: man utd 's poole loaned to cobblers

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's it for another week of live updates for northamptonshire .
thanks for joining us .
you can scroll back here for anything you might have missed , including :
do n't forget , northamptonshire 's cricketers begin the defence of their t20 title in half an hour 's time against derbyshire .
there 's commentary from wantage road on bbc radio northampton .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , weather and travel for the county at 08:00 on monday .
have a great weekend .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: man u youngster on his way to the cobblers
text: northampton town have signed young manchester united defender regan poole on a season-long loan .
poole , 19 , moved to old trafford in 2015 from newport county , where he played under current cobblers boss justin edinburgh .
but his only united appearance to date was as a late sub in the europa league under louis van gaal in february 2016 .
the wales under-21 man comes in as competition for cobblers centre-backs ash taylor and leon barnett .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy with possibility of sharp showers
text: cloud will develop from the north west bringing a small chance of isolated sharp showers across the bbc east region tonight .
but it will remain dry for many areas with clear spells later .
light rain or drizzle is possible across western counties later as the temperature falls to 12c ( 54f ) in places .
saturday will be another dry day with sunny spells and some cloud and it will be cooler on the coast .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 76f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: a look at the papers
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: david miller murder trial : homeless ian cuthbertson had gone to victim 's house 'for a bath '
text: a homeless man accused of killing a man in his own home was `` petrified '' while the attack was carried out , a court has heard .
the body of david miller , 56 , was found at his flat on patterdale walk in boothville , northampton , on 14 june 2016 .
mr miller had been stabbed multiple times and crude attempts had been made to destroy his body .
ian cuthbertson , 49 ; michael hallett , 37 ; joseph catlin , 30 , and zena kane , 35 , of no fixed address , all deny murder .
northampton crown court was told mr cuthbertson had simply gone to the house for `` a bath , a change of clothing and to watch tv '' but had been caught up in a `` truly horrific '' crime .
the case continues .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: killers of vulnerable man acted like 'pack of wolves ' , court told
text: four homeless people acted like `` a pack of wolves '' when they killed a vulnerable man in his own home , a court has heard .
the partially-dismembered body of david miller , 56 , was found at his flat in patterdale walk , boothville , northampton , on 14 june 2016 .
he had been stabbed multiple times and `` crude attempts '' were made to destroy his body , northampton crown court was told .
ian cuthbertson , 49 ; michael hallett , 37 ; joseph catlin , 30 , and zena kane , 35 , of no fixed address , deny murder .
summing up , prosecutor peter joyce qc said the only possible verdicts were guilty of `` murder , murder , murder , murder '' .
he told the jury : `` it is not argued that what happened to david miller was n't murder .
`` the question is whether one or all of these four defendants took part . ''
he called the killing of mr miller `` a team job '' , saying that was why none of the accused had given evidence during the trial .
mr joyce dismissed a statement to police by mr cuthbertson - in which he denied he had been at the scene - as `` lie , after pathetic lie , after pathetic lie '' .
he also accused ms zane of `` crocodile tears and humbug and hypocrisy '' .
the case continues .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: austrian gp practice : lewis hamilton top again
text: mercedes driver lewis hamilton kept up the pace and finished fastest at the end of the second free practice at the austrian grand prix , with a 1:05.483 .
the stevenage racer was 0.147secs ahead of title rival sebastian vettel of ferrari .

then it 's the second brackley-built mercedes of valtteri bottas ( +0.216 ) , followed by the milton keynes-based red bulls of max verstappen and daniel ricciardo , and ferrari 's kimi raikkonen in sixth .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: your blue skies
text: lots of sunshine again today in northamptonshire .
and it 's been beautifully captured , as ever , by our bbc weather watchers
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: afternoon weather : turning cloudier
text: a few clouds will pass over northamptonshire this afternoon , but there will be plenty more sunny spells too .
it will stay dry and warm , though not quite as warm as yesterday afternoon .
a top temperature of 24c ( 75f ) .
weather has more .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man stabbed in northampton park
text: a man has been repeatedly stabbed as he walked home through dallington park .
he was approached by a man who demanded his phone and wallet .
as he tried to fight him off , he was approached by another man and stabbed in the neck , stomach and chest , with what the police described as a `` small unknown pointed object '' .
his injuries are said to be `` minor '' .
it happened between 03:30 and 04:00 on monday .
one of the offenders was black , about 5ft 5in tall and was wearing dark clothing .
he was believed to have had a tattoo of a face or an animal on his left hand .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: new children 's services trust 'a step towards privatisation ' - union
text: as we 've just mentioned , the government has given northamptonshire county council £ 4m to set up a new company to manage the day-to-day running of children 's services .
the authority says it will allow the department to be run in a more efficient way than if it continued to be managed directly by the council .

but penny smith from the union , unison , said : `` our children 's services previously have n't been up to standard and i worry that this will alter the level of care to young people in northamptonshire .

`` i am very concerned that eventually it 'll become a private company and i 've always felt that public services should be run by the public , for the public and delivered in the public interest . ''
lesley hagger , director of children 's services at northamptonshire county council , said : `` this new company will be a public service company and wholly owned by the local authority .
`` local government , by the nature of how it 's organised , is quite bureaucratic , and this will enable us to spend more time working with children and families .
`` it gives us more freedom and flexibility to change the way we do things . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: £ 4m for new children 's services trust in the county
text: northamptonshire county council has been given £ 4m from the government to help set up a new trust to run its children 's services - the first of its kind in the country .
it means it will be run day-to-day by a separate company rather than directly by the council .
however , this company will be set-up by and wholly owned by the authority , which will monitor and remain responsible for its performance .
northamptonshire 's children 's services is a department under extreme pressure - having to help more and more children - and has had a troubled history .
inspectors from the watchdog , ofsted , previously said it was `` inadequate '' , but last year they moved it up a category to `` requires improvement '' .
the council believes this new trust will mean children 's services can be run more efficiently , but the union , unison , is concerned it 's just a step towards privatisation .
it 's likely to be up and running by april 2018 .
we 'll look at their arguments in more detail shortly .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: saints fixtures announced
text: the fixtures have been announced for the forthcoming premiership rugby season .
it starts for northampton saints at twickenham on 2 september - they 're saracens ' opponents in the london double header .
then , on the back of that , they 're at home to leicester on saturday , 9 september .
the other east midlands derby is at welford road in april .
the tough start to the season continues with a friday evening game at home to bath .
other matches that stand out are another trip to twickenham to play harlequins around new year - they 're at home to exeter just before christmas .
and the regular season ends for saints at franklin 's gardens on 5 may against worcester .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: exeter start title defence at gloucester
text: exeter start title defence at gloucester

documents.title: austrian gp practice : lewis hamilton top
text: mercedes driver lewis hamilton set a scintillating pace in first practice at the austrian grand prix as he left title rival sebastian vettel trailing .
the stevenage racer was 0.449secs quicker than ferrari 's vettel , despite using the slowest soft tyre and vettel the faster super-soft .
the german was fourth fastest , behind milton keynes-based red bull 's max verstappen and the second brackley-built mercedes of valtteri bottas .
vettel is 14 points ahead of hamilton as f1 resumes two weeks after their controversial collision in baku .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: posh and u 's to meet in first competitive fixture for years
text: peterborough united , cambridge united and northampton town will all be placed in the same group in next season 's efl trophy .
it 'll be the first time county rivals posh and u 's will meet in a competitive fixture since december 2001 .
the fourth side - an invited academy team - will be announced next week .
the dates for the ties are yet to be announced .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: daventry 's 'canal to nowhere ' approved
text: the first phase of daventry 's new canal extension was approved by senior councillors last night .
as we reported yesterday , the eventual aim is to extend the grand union canal to a marina near the town centre .
but the initial plan is to spend £ 8m on creating a 0.75 mile ( 1.2km ) length of canal that does n't connect to the grand union at one end and does n't go close to the town centre at the other .

people against the plans have described it as a `` canal to nowhere '' and - with the slogan `` ditch the ditch '' - a small group of protesters greeted councillors as they arrived for their meeting .
they believe it 's a waste of money , for what one man described as `` a long , thin swimming pool '' .
but councillors believed this first phase would create a popular attraction and would reassure housing developers the full canal really is coming .
they 're confident that funding will eventually be found to connect this waterway to the grand union .
the plan now has to be considered by the full council .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants to begin t20 title defence
text: northamptonshire 's cricketers begin the defence of their t20 title tonight .
the steelbacks entertain derbyshire at wantage road .
they 've won the tournament twice in the last four seasons - and were runners-up once - so head coach david ripley admits they ca n't really be called underdogs any more .
`` even the bookies have got us , i think , fourth-favourites , so we 're recognised as a good team , '' he said .
`` we are a good team - we 've always known that - but it 's been nice to come under the radar a little bit .
`` certainly , derbyshire will be absolutely sprinting down the m1 to take us on on friday night , and show that they can beat the champions .
`` we 've got that through all our group games , so we 'll have to be up for that challenge and play our best cricket . ''
there 'll be full coverage on bbc radio northampton from 18:30 .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: t20 blast back with 'serious firepower '
text: t20 blast back with 'serious firepower '
author: Gary Smee
BBC Sport

some rain showers are expected during a very muggy night .

documents.title: jessie 's days as a hospital dog are numbered
text: jessie the pet therapy dog has been visiting patients at northampton general hospital for the past three years .
nurses there have described her as `` the best medicine '' and `` better than any prescription '' .
but her time on the wards is coming to an end due to the introduction of parking fees , which the hospital says are to help with the costs of a new building .

documents.title: man stabbed in northampton park
text: a man required hospital treatment after being stabbed at the racecourse in northampton .
police said he was attacked `` with an unknown weapon '' near the basketball courts at about 13:00 yesterday , and are appealing for witnesses .
he 's recovering from a stomach wound which needed stitches .
the offender is described as a white latvian man , around 30 years old with short balding hair and was wearing a black jacket and light coloured trainers .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: afternoon weather : possible thunder
text: staying hot and humid this afternoon with plenty of sunshine but the risk of some thunder .
many areas will stay dry but there will be some isolated , heavy downpours .
a top temperature of 26c ( 79f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: a look at the papers
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: fairline to hire more staff
text: oundle-based luxury boat-builder fairline yachts is looking to recruit 50 new members of staff .
the company went into administration at the end of 2015 with the loss of 400 jobs .
last year it was bought by russian investors , who closed its other factory , in corby .
miles moorhouse , from fairline , said : `` the demand for our products around the world has taken us somewhat by surprise so we 're keen to up our levels of staffing .
`` we have just under 300 people as of today and we need another 50 or so skilled tradespeople to come on board as soon as possible . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: 'a result is still possible'kent 701-7d v northants 568
text: we have finally reached the half-way stage in this game - it 's taken until the fourth morning after a total run-glut at beckenham .
after kent 's record total against northamptonshire , the away side have responded with their record total against kent .
it 's seen them get past the follow-on mark , which has put a big dent in kent 's hopes of forcing victory .
but the home side have still managed to take a 133-run lead and with 81 overs left in the match , a result is still just about possible .

runs have been very easy to come by in this game , so if kent batted for 30 overs and pushed the lead to say 320 , sending northants back in for 50 overs with the chance of a valuable victory dangling in front of them we could yet see a thrilling finish here .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: cricket excitement at fever pitch ( ish )
text: play is just resuming on the fourth and final day of northamptonshire 's county championship match against kent .
it does n't seem to be a sell-out crowd at beckenham .
click here for full commentary .
perhaps 30 spectators in the ground but it could yet be an exciting final day at beckenham # bbccricket
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: canal to nowhere could be approved
text: plans to build the first section of daventry 's canal extension could be approved tonight .
the eventual aim is to extend the grand union canal to a marina near the town centre .
but the first phase wo n't get as far as the existing waterway .
the idea of having a canal extension into daventry has been around for more than a decade but , apart from one bridge , there 's no real sign of it happening on the ground .

so the proposal to daventry district council 's strategy group later is to create a 0.75 mile ( 1.2km ) length of the canal that does n't connect to the grand union at one end and does n't go close to the town centre at the other .
the only boats you might see on it are small pleasure craft .
this would cost the council £ 8m but the hope is to find the funding to complete the whole project .
the question is when - or indeed if - this will happen .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rain and thunder warning in place
text: the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for rain in northamptonshire for today .
heavy downpours and isolated thunderstorms are predicted later this afternoon , which could bring some flash flooding .
lightning and hail may be additional hazards .
however , any outbreaks are likely to be extremely localised , meaning most places should stay dry .
the warning is likely to be in place until 02:00 tomorrow .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cricket : kent v northants heading for a draw
text: an innings of 153 from northamptonshire 's max holden helped the county to within 24 runs of avoiding the follow-on in their championship match against kent at beckenham yesterday .
northamptonshire reached 528-7 at close , in reply to kent 's 701 , as the game continues to head for a draw .
holden and adam rossington put on 239 for the fifth wicket - rossington eventually out for 112 - the third centurian of the innings .
holden , 19 , told me it was a day to remember : `` it 's been a great experience with northants so far .
`` it 's the last game for the moment and who knows what 's going to happen further down the line - but it 's nice to go out in style . ''
play resumes at 11:00 .
click here for full commentary .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: £ 2m extra for special needs schools in northamptonshire
text: as we 've been reporting , head teachers at special educational needs ( sen ) schools in the county have told us they 're struggling to cope with the increase in demand for places .

a department for education spokesman said : `` we know that local authorities have faced additional demands , which is why this year we are providing an extra £ 130m 'high needs ' funding to help councils meet those pressures .
`` northamptonshire 's share of that additional high needs funding is almost £ 2m . ''
northamptonshire county council said it was paying for more than 600 new sen places over the next two years .
in a statement , it said : `` the county council is funding extensions at some special educational needs schools to tackle the current pressure on places .
`` the council has also collaborated with external stakeholders such as academy trusts and the education and skills funding agency regarding the opening of a number of sen free schools . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: special schools struggling to cope with demand
text: funding for special educational needs ( sen ) schools in northamptonshire is not keeping up with the `` massive '' increase in demand , according to local head teachers .
in september , 65 reception-age pupils ( four and five-years-old ) started at sen schools in the county , which is 50 % higher than the year before .
demand for secondary school places has increased by 20 % in five years .
kevin latham , head teacher at isebrook sen college in kettering , said : `` we have to make decisions about the equipment students have , such as special seating .
`` some of these pieces of equipment cost up to £ 5,000 , which is a lot of money that we could be directing towards a member of staff . ''

sheralee webb , the executive head teacher at northgate school arts college , a secondary school for pupils with special educational needs in northampton , said : `` i know the local authorities are trying to work with other schools to put extra provision on them , but it 's whether they can meet that demand fast enough .

`` if you build 30,000 houses in a town , like they 're going to in northampton , a certain percentage of those people are going to have children with special needs and where are they going to go to school ? ''
northamptonshire county council and the government have told us they 're spending more money on special needs provision in the county .
we 'll have their full reaction shortly .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: weather : warm day with thunderstorms possible
text: a warm start to the day , with sunny spells after any early fog .
increasing risk of thunderstorms mainly later in the day , with local intense downpours and possible hail , bringing the risk of sudden flooding .
feeling very warm and humid by the afternoon , with highs of 26c ( 79f ) .
get the latest on the weather where you live on the bbc weather website .

a full weather forecast is on the way but - a word of warning - you might need both a brolly and sunscreen today .

documents.title: holden 'calm and composed'kent 701-7d v northants 398-4 ( 115 overs )
text: a perfect summer 's day at beckenham and a pity that there is only one round of championship cricket scheduled for the next seven weeks over the middle part of the summer .
saying that , the locals have n't turned out today and the crowd is down by a good margin on the first two days .
that 's perhaps because of the state of this game and a flat wicket that is yielding a bucket-load of runs .
northants had slipped into a tricky position at lunch but dominated the afternoon , not losing a wicket , and now the mark to save the follow-on is within reach .
max holden is playing the final match of his loan spell at northamptonshire from middlesex and has again demonstrated what a fine talent he is .

calm and composed , eating up deliveries , biding his time and selling his wicket dearly - just classic proper first-class batting and a thoroughly deserved century , precisely what his side required .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: shops caught selling e-cigarettes to children
text: children working for northamptonshire trading standards have been able to buy electronic cigarettes at nearly half of the shops they 've tested so far this year .
of 40 retailers visited , the devices were sold 19 times .
since october 2015 it has been illegal for retailers to sell the devices to under-18s , with a maximum fine of £ 2,500 for those caught doing it .
paul maylunn , from trading standards , said : `` the technical term is 'nicotine inhaling products ' .
`` these new e-cigarettes have come in and are on sale in all kinds of shops , which are n't used to selling age-restricted products .
`` their inexperience means they do n't appreciate they should be age-restricting them . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: statues 'good for economic growth '
text: here 's the response from northampton borough council to criticism of those five bronze statues installed at the guildhall yesterday .
the two main points people seem to be making are about the £ 44,000 cost and the fact the statues are all based in just one location .

tim hadland , cabinet member for regeneration , enterprise and planning , said : `` the guildhall is at the heart of the town and has long been popular with visitors , so it 's an excellent spot to showcase some of the characters who have helped to make northampton a vibrant and interesting place over the years .
`` this installation is a celebration of culture and although it can be difficult to put a precise figure against , this type of investment is good for the economic growth of town centres .
`` in 2013 , arts council england published a report which showed that arts and culture generate more per pound invested than in many other sectors .
`` the statues were paid for through the capital fund , which exists to allow us to invest in our town in this way .
`` we 're proud of our heritage , and alongside other regeneration and enterprise projects we 'll continue to invest in and promote what northampton has to offer . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: northampton 's new statues criticised
text: as we reported yesterday , five new bronze statues have been unveiled at northampton 's guildhall and were opened up to the public this morning .
they de historical figures with links to the town and stand alongside the statue of poet john clare , which has been there for over a year .
but not everyone 's impressed .
in fact , a number of people commenting on a northampton chronicle facebook post said they were annoyed at the location of the statues and the fact they cost £ 44,000 .

one person wrote the money could have been used `` towards the homeless that are on our streets '' , and another said they were `` disgusted and embarrassed to say i live in northampton when they spend a fortune on pointless things '' .
however , other people called them a `` wonderful idea '' and `` fantastic '' .
we 've put these comments to northampton borough council and will bring you their reaction shortly .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: afternoon weather : warm with sunny spells
text: it 'll be a dry afternoon with sunny spells and light winds .
feeling warm in the sunshine , with a top temperature of 24c ( 75f ) .
weather has more .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: video-streaming app 'supporting ' police to protect users
text: the company behind a video-streaming app which northamptonshire police issued a warning about says it has policies in place to protect users against sexual exploitation .
we reported yesterday that the force had written to all schools in the county urging headteachers to be aware of live.me , which allows users to broadcast videos of themselves .
police said they 're aware of an investigation in another area into a young child being directed to engage in sexual activity , which was viewed thousands of times .

a live.me spokesman said : `` our community guidelines reflect our zero-tolerance policy towards any indecent or inappropriate behaviour , and we take all allegations of violations against those guidelines very seriously .

`` beyond existing safeguards in our app , and strict protocols for our moderators to address any reports of violations , we also actively support law enforcement in identifying and prosecuting any users found to be endangering our community in any way .

`` beyond automatic software detection and human moderators in place 24 hours a day , we also have tools for users to report and block people from their broadcasts , and we are continually improving those tools and resources for users . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: your summer 's back
text: northamptonshire 's been treated to lots of warm sunshine so far today .
these from our bbc weather watchers say it all
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cobblers boss hoping for more signings
text: i 've been to see cobblers boss justin edinburgh today , ahead of the start of pre-season on saturday and the club 's week in spain .
edinburgh says going abroad will give them a great chance to get to know each other and put some serious hard work in .
yesterday , the cobblers signed iraq international yaser kasim on a two-year contract , after the 26-year-old turned down a new deal at swindon town .
and , following that signing , we spoke about the chances of more personnel arriving before the start of the season .
edinburgh said : `` ideally we need a goalkeeper , three central defenders , maybe another midfielder and a forward - then i 'd be a happy man . ''

regarding the feeling around the camp ahead of the new season , he said : `` there 's a different dynamic , a totally different vibe around the ground - more professional and the standards are higher among the group '' .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: cricket : day three of kent v northants
text: northamptonshire will look to salvage a draw in their championship match against kent after another day when bat dominated ball at beckenham .
at close northamptonshire were 180-1 , thanks to an unbeaten century from ben duckett ( below ) - his second in consecutive matches .
this came in reply to kent 's mammoth 701-7 declared - the highest total ever made against northants in first class cricket .
sean dickson made 318 .
duckett and newton responded with an opening stand of 113 - newton eventually going for 57 , but duckett still there on 101 .
play resumes at 11:00 .
click here for full commentary .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: hospital boss defends cutting free parking for volunteers
text: volunteers provide all kinds of services in the nhs .
but , as we 've been reporting , charity workers at northampton general hospital ( ngh ) will have to start paying for their own parking from august .
the exception will be those volunteers who are managed directly by the hospital , who will continue to have their parking expenses reimbursed .

deborah needham , chief operating officer at the hospital , said : `` we built our new urgent care unit just outside accident and emergency , which is fantastic news for patients , but means we 're losing parking spaces .
`` this prompted us to review our parking arrangements and it showed we were n't being consistent with third-party organisations .
`` with volunteers - it 's the charity which normally pays for their expenses .
`` so , for the volunteers that work directly for ngh , we will pay for their parking .
`` but we would urge charities which are working with us to reimburse their volunteers for their parking and expenses . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: free parking for hospital volunteers to be scrapped
text: it 's feared new parking charges at northampton general hospital ( ngh ) could lead to a shortage of volunteer workers there .
at the moment all charity staff can park for free , but this will come to an end from august .
one of the organisations affected is the friends group , whose 80 volunteers help patients find their way around the hospital , offer a buggy service to those less mobile , and run a shop .
john patterson from the group , said : `` we 're almost all retired and to volunteer for four hours a day then pay £ 5 for the privilege seems a bit harsh .
`` other volunteers who work on the wards - the ngh trust volunteers - are still being allowed to reclaim their parking , but we 're not . ''
rosemary wooler is a volunteer for the charity pets as therapy , which takes dogs on to wards to meet patients and help ease their stress .
she said : `` one volunteer has left because he 's a pensioner and ca n't afford the car parking , so those two wards that he visits are now without a dog . ''
ngh says a review of its parking arrangements has resulted in removing free parking for third-party organisations .
we 'll have their full response shortly .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: tory mp 'amazed ' at how many knew of fraud probe
text: the mp for wellingborough has told a court he was `` amazed '' at the amount of people who knew he was being investigated over fraud allegations .
adam simmonds ( below ) , 40 , the former northamptonshire police and crime commissioner , is accused of discussing the probe with politicians including mps within the tory party .
mr bone said he was assured the matter was being dealt with confidentially after his home was searched by police in march 2013 .

but the conservative mp soon found the `` rumour mill '' , surrounding payment of fees for the care of an elderly relative , was `` in full swing '' , including allegations against him and his wife jeanette .
`` i was amazed to find out how many did know .
of course , i was not aware of all of them at that time , '' he said , giving evidence at southwark crown court .

`` one of the key moments was when thomas pursglove , now the mp for corby and east northamptonshire , told me that he had been told by a county councillor quite considerable detail about the investigation , and that was a complete surprise . ''
on mr simmonds , mr bone ( above ) said : `` i have known him a long time and i think he was an excellent pcc . ''
he added he did not believe mr simmonds was responsible for leaking information that later appeared in a string of articles in the times .
mr bone described the allegations against him as `` completely bogus and made up '' and the crown prosecution service announced it would not bring any charges against him or his wife in march 2014 .
mr simmonds , from leicester , denies unlawfully obtaining or disclosing personal data between 1 may 2013 and 1 may 2014 .
the trial continues .

documents.title: in new statues unveiled in northampton
text: for over a year , poet john clare has sat alone in the courtyard of northampton 's guildhall - though he has received a steady stream of visitors in that time .
now he 's been joined by five new life-sized models de other famous folk with links to northampton .
the borough council decided to spend £ 44,000 on them because of the `` positive response '' to the john clare statue .
they 've been designed and made in cornwall by the same sculptor , richard austin , who says this one of malcom arnold is his favourite .
arnold was a composer who wrote the score for the film the bridge over the river kwai .
below is the statue of edgar mobbs .
he raised his own company of sportsmen for the northamptonshire regiment after initially being turned down as too old to join the army .
he was killed in action in july 1917 .
francis crick was a nobel prize winner who was educated at the northampton town and county grammar school and went on to co-discover the dna molecule .
lady wantage was a philanthropist who helped set up the national aid society - the forerunner of the british red cross society .
in the 1890s , lady wantage gave the land for abington park to northampton .
this statue will spend the summer at abington park museum before returning to the guildhall .
and last but not least , walter tull joined northampton town football club in 1911 before becoming the first black officer to lead white british soldiers in battle during world war one .
the statues will be officially unveiled at a special event later this month , but will be accessible from tomorrow morning if you fancy taking a look for yourselves .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: police boss 'not permitted ' to share probe details , says former chief constable
text: a former police and crime commissioner did not have permission to share details of a criminal investigation , a court has heard .
adam simmonds ( 40 , has pleaded not guilty to knowingly or recklessly passing on details of a fraud probe involving wellingborough mp peter bone .

southwark crown court heard from retired northamptonshire police chief constable adrian lee , who called the investigation `` sensitive '' and said he had not given permission for the case to be discussed .
the case against mr bone was eventually dropped by the crown prosecution service .
the court heard conservative mr simmonds discussed the investigation , which dates back to 2013 , with other members of his party , including mps michael ellis and chris heaton-harris .
mr lee said he spoke about the issue of confidentiality with mr simmonds after he was elected as pcc in 2012 .
he said he had not expected mr simmonds to disclose information about the `` high-profile '' probe into mr bone , except to senior colleagues within the office of the pcc .
`` i 'm very clear i did n't give permission and permission was never sought , '' he told the court .
mr lee said had permission been sought , he would have sought advice from the senior investigating officer and a data protection officer .
he said mr simmonds ' knowledge of the police was `` weak '' when he was elected , but praised his hard work .
the trial continues .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: local council funding 'needs sorting quickly '
text: the leader of northamptonshire county council says the government needs to be `` much clearer '' about how much money it 'll give local councils in the future .
according to the local government association ( lga ) , by 2020 councils will have lost 75p in every £ 1 of central government funding compared to 2015 .
county council leader heather smith , conservative ( said : `` this has got to be sorted out and quickly .
`` we already knew before the election about all the pressures we were under concerning social care .
`` the government wants to see closer collaboration between social care and health - and that is happening .
`` but the health economy in northamptonshire is under just as much pressure as we are . ''

the department for communities and local government said a new four-year financial settlement had given councils increased financial certainty , while town halls were also able to raise millions in extra funding for social care through a precept on council tax .

a spokesman said : `` ministers have committed through a manifesto pledge to further help local authorities control more of what they raise , and we 're working closely with the lga to agree the best way to achieve this . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: alex ward knocked out of wimbledon
text: i 'm afraid it 's bad news for northampton 's alex ward .
despite us sending him all our best luck he 's out of wimbledon , with the world number 855 being beaten by fellow brit , kyle edmund .
ward ( took the first set 6-4 , but edmund came back 6-3 , 6-2 , 6-1 .
the 27-year-old can at least console himself with £ 35,000 in prize money , while edmund , 22 , will bank at least £ 57,000 by reaching the second round .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: tunnel near daventry to be used for vehicle testing
text: work could soon get under way on turning a disused railway tunnel in northamptonshire into one of the most advanced wind tunnels in the world .
catesby tunnel , near daventry , is 2.5km ( 1.55 miles ) long and planning permission for its conversion has been granted - with funding nearly in place .
it would be used to test motor vehicle performance and aerodynamics .
brackley-based total sim will operate the tunnel .
rob lewi from the company said : `` the reason this is ideal is because of the size and scale .
`` the length means you 've got time to get up to speed with a series of experiments then slow down and turn around .
`` the longer the tunnel , the more you can do in it , and this is almost the longest we 've got in the uk . ''
richard wakeford , from engineering company stepnell which is converting the tunnel , said : `` there 's a huge number of challenges .
`` working in an old structure like this , we 're faced with a lot of water ingress .
`` supervising work in a tunnel this long and the logistics around it are quite difficult . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: your some sunshine
text: weather-wise , it 's not been a bad day so far in northamptonshire .
check out these photos captured by our bbc weather watchers
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: afternoon weather : mostly dry and bright
text: some more bright or sunny spells will develop this afternoon .
it 'll stay largely dry for most places , although there is a chance of the odd light shower .
a top temperature of 20c ( 68f ) .
for the full forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .

documents.title: 'northants going through the motions'kent 547-2 ( 120 overs ) v northants
text: kent are piling the runs on again on the second morning and it has been amazing to be here for their record partnership .
there have been 170-odd years of history at this club - but today was the day that sean dickson and joe denly eclipsed them all .
the record total for kent against northamptonshire will soon go to as kent work themselves up towards whatever total they want really .
they should be past 700 before tea and that will leave northants 550 to save the follow-on and seven sessions left in the game .
not a bad spot to be in .
nothing has changed at all for the fielding side and they are just going through the motions , little else to do with runs just so easy to come by .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: parents advised to 'reiterate online safety ' to children
text: northamptonshire police has urged parents to make sure they understand the dangers of the internet , particularly social media .
det sgt nickie deeks said : `` please can we ask all parents to reiterate online safety to their children and be aware of what apps or sites their children are visiting . ''
it 's after news today that the force has written to all schools in the county , warning them about young people 's use of video streaming app live.me and snapchat .
here are the police 's tips on keeping children safe online :
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: schools warned about video streaming app
text: concerns about a live video streaming app have led to northamptonshire police writing to every school in the county .
detectives are urging headteachers and parents to be aware of the live.me app and website , which allows users to broadcast videos of themselves and watch other people 's live feeds .
police say they 're aware of an investigation in another force area into a young child being directed to engage in sexual activity , which was viewed thousands of times .

in the letter to schools , det sgt nickie deeks also warned about a new feature on photo-sharing app snapchat : `` parents should also be aware that in relation to the latest snapchat update , public settings allow users to find someone 's exact location .
`` snapchat 'hotspots ' produces a map which allows you to see their exact location down to the house they are in .
`` children and young people are vulnerable for a number of reasons to being sexually exploited through the use of the internet and , in particular , social media . ''
the live.me app 's terms of use specify that users must be aged 18 or have parental permission to log in .
the terms and conditions state : `` we have a zero-tolerance policy against child sexual abuse imagery .
`` if we become aware of any user content containing any child sexual abuse imagery , we will report it to the appropriate authorities immediately and delete the submitting user accounts . ''
we 've contacted the firm for further comment .
meanwhile , a snapchat spokesman told the bbc : `` with snap map , location sharing is off by default for all users and is completely optional .
`` snapchatters can choose exactly who they want to share their location with , if at all , and can change that setting at any time .
`` it 's also not possible to share your location with someone who is n't already your friend on snapchat , and the majority of interactions on snapchat take place between close friends . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: sale of weetabix to us company completed
text: it 's been confirmed that the sale of weetabix to us company post holdings has been completed - for $ 1.8bn ( £ 1.4bn ) .
weetabix , which is based in burton latimer , makes three billion biscuits a year and employs 2,000 people .
its sale was announced in april and unions expressed concern over future job security , saying they 'd seek urgent meetings with the new owners .
there 's been no specific threat made about jobs in northamptonshire and it 's understood that sales of the company 's products have remained stable .
weetabix says it will continue to support local farmers and source all its wheat from the surrounding area .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: number of elected councillors in harborough set to be cut
text: the local government boundary commission has approved plans to cut the number of elected members on harborough district council .
final recommendations for the the area , published this morning , mean the electorate now will choose 34 councillors at the next election , down from 37 .
the new arrangements will take effect in time for the next council elections in 2019 .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester political reporter

documents.title: silverstone from above
text: this national police air service crew had a fantastic view of silverstone on their way back to raf benson in oxfordshire .
of course , not long to go now until the f1 grand prix !
but how well do you know your circuits ?
silverstone , on route back to benson
f1 fans perhaps ?
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: cricket : day two of kent v northants
text: yesterday was a very tough day for northamptonshire 's cricketers against kent at beckenham .
the home side won the toss , batted first and lost just one wicket all day in the championship match , closing on 434-1 .
sean dickson is 210 not out , joe denly with him on 143 - their second wicket partnership is currently worth 305 .
northamptonshire captain alex wakely ( said it was one of the toughest days in the field .
`` we really do n't know what to say about it , '' he said .
`` a couple of opportunities did n't go our way early on .
`` we 've tried various different tactics with the ball and fielded ok for the majority of it , but the two guys have batted very well on a very good pitch . ''
click here to listen to full commentary of day two from 11:00 .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: mum 'proud ' of wimbledon hopeful
text: as we 've just mentioned , northampton 's alex ward plays today in the first round at wimbledon .
the 27-year-old takes on fellow briton , kyle edmund , on court three at 11:30 .
alex 's mum , sue tarry , said she 's delighted he 's qualified for the championships for the first time , after receiving a wildcard entry last year .
`` i am really proud - proud does n't really cover it , '' she said .
`` i actually admire my son for the choices he 's made and for the path he 's chosen for himself and the fact he 's done it by making his own decisions and taking some risks .
`` perhaps i would n't have had the courage to do that myself . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: alex ward expecting 'tough ' match at wimbledon
text: northampton tennis player alex ward goes into wimbledon ranked 855th in the world .
he faces kyle edmund at 11:30 and said : `` i know kyle very well - we 've trained together quite a few times .
`` he 's a great player and is doing really well at establishing himself as a top-50 player .
`` so it 'll definitely be a tough match , but i ca n't wait to get out there . ''
we 'll tell you how he gets on later in the day .
preparing
have a great wimbledon alex .
( i 'm bath to rome phil 's mum . )
come on alex do it for the town
have a great game
good luck mate
good luck @ twitterid and enjoy it
good luck alex !
nice alex
good luck .
go a full ! !
great match yesterday , keep positive you 'll get there !
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

as we get into the afternoon the cloud will thin and break bringing spells of sunshine .

documents.title: former pcc 'told tory colleagues details of mp fraud case '
text: a former police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) breached data protection laws by telling conservative colleagues details about an ongoing fraud case against an mp , a court has heard .
adam simmonds , who served as northamptonshire 's pcc until last year , appeared at southwark crown court accused of disclosing personal data about the tory mp for wellingborough , peter bone .
the prosecution said mr simmonds used the information to `` aid the conservative party '' .
mr simmonds has pleaded not guilty to knowingly or recklessly breaching the data protection act .

the court heard the 40-year-old , from northcote road , leicester , had conversations with northamptonshire mps michael ellis , christopher heaton-harris and other politicians about an investigation into mr bone .
the alleged offence is said to have taken place between november 2013 and may 2014 .
mr simmonds was copied in to a number of emails from police officers investigating mr bone in relation to an allegation of fraud involving the care of an elderly relative .
the case against mr bone and his wife , jeanette , was dropped by the crown prosecution service in 2014 .
the case is expected to last two to three weeks .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: weather
text: the last of any showers should quickly clear to leave a mainly dry night across the bbc east region with variable amounts of cloud and light winds .
most places staying in double figures overnight with temperatures no lower than 11c ( 52f ) .
tuesday will be largely fine and dry , although cloud is likely to thicken from the south during the day .
any showers will be very isolated and mainly in the north of the region accompanied by light winds .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f )
more details for where you are from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: bronze statues of famous northamptonians to be installed
text: it 's been announced that five bronze statues will be installed in northampton tomorrow .
they 've been designed by richard austin - the artist behind the statue of poet john clare ( below ) which was unveiled at the guildhall last year .
the new life-sized models , which cost £ 44,000 , will de these historical figures :
francis crick : nobel prize winner who was educated at the northampton town and county grammar school and went on to co-discover the dna molecule .
walter tull : joined northampton town football club in 1911 before becoming the first black officer to lead white british soldiers in battle during world war i .
malcolm arnold : composers who wrote the score for the film the bridge over the river kwai .
edgar mobbs : raised his own company of sportsmen for the northamptonshire regiment after initially being turned down as too old to join the army .
he was killed in action in july 1917 .
lady wantage : philanthropist who helped to set up the national aid society - the forerunner of the british red cross society .
in the 1890s lady wantage gave the land for abington park to northampton .
lady wantage will spend the summer at abington park museum while the rest of the figures will join john clare to line the courtyard of the guildhall .

tim hadland , cabinet member for regeneration , enterprise and planning at northampton borough council , said : `` we received such a positive response to john clare that we wanted to extend the project to include other talented and inspirational former northampton residents .
`` the guildhall is at the heart of the town and is itself steeped in history , so it seems a fitting home for these figures who have each added to our rich heritage in their own way . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: power fully restored in northampton town centre
text: engineers have fixed an underground electricity fault in the derngate and guildhall road area of northampton , which led to reports of smoke billowing from a drain cover .
emergency services were called just before 07:00 and a section of road was temporarily closed .
western power distribution said there was no fire but about 40 properties had their power cut off to allow the problem to be fixed .
electricity has now been fully restored .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: your sunshine in northamptonshire
text: as we 've just mentioned , the good news is we 've got monday morning out of the way and the sun 's out .
our bbc weather watchers have been capturing the county in all its glory
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: afternoon weather : some warm sunshine
text: it will be turning drier and brighter through this afternoon , with some warm summer sunshine and light winds .
a top temperature of 21c ( 70f ) .
weather has more .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: witness list revealed at adam simmonds ' trial
text: a list of witnesses read out at the trial of former northamptonshire police and crime commissioner , adam simmonds , reads like a political who 's who for the county .
the 40-year-old , from leicester , denies knowingly or recklessly breaching the data protection act by disclosing information about peter bone , the mp for wellingborough .
the witnesses include mr bone himself , fellow northamptonshire mps tom pursglove , chris heaton-harris and michael ellis , and former northampton south mp david mackintosh .

also named were former northamptonshire police chief constable adrian lee , county council chief executive dr paul blantern , former county council leader jim harker and mr simmonds ' former strategic adviser stuart mccartney .
some witnesses are being used for the prosecution while others are being used for the defence .
the trial , at southwark crown court , is expected to last beyond two weeks .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: northampton bypass exhibition begins
text: the first of a series of exhibitions about the proposed northampton north-west bypass has opened in kingsthorpe today .
the new road will take traffic from moulton on the a43 around the edge of the town and join up with the harlestone road .
the first stage of the project will cost £ 32m .
the consultation documents claim the bypass would `` provide extra traffic capacity in the area where some 10,000 new homes are planned '' .
timeline of consultation events :
people have until friday , 4 august , to have their say on the plans .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: jury sworn in for adam simmonds trial
text: a jury has been sworn in for the trial of former northamptonshire police and crime commissioner , adam simmonds .
the 40-year-old , from leicester , has appeared at southwark crown court accused of disclosing personal data about wellingborough mp , peter bone .
the proceedings so far have been dominated by legal arguments , with witnesses not expected to appear until 14:00 at the earliest .
the case is expected to go into a third week before it is completed .
mr simmonds pleads not guilty to breaching the data protection act .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: 'spin expected at beckenham'kent 53-0 v northants
text: big week at beckenham with third versus fourth in the division two table , with just seven points between the sides .
the winner this week will be into the promotion places ahead of the upcoming t20 break .
both sides are expecting the wicket to help the spinners because both have specialists in their sides - yasir shah playing his last game for kent , while graeme white is in for northants .
it appears to be a very good toss to win and kent have the early advantage here .
kent are at beckenham for the first time this season .
it is good to be spreading the game around such a large area but the south east is let down by fixture list - there is another game taking place at the oval just seven miles away this week .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: smoke reported in town centre after electrical fault
text: the police and fire service had reports of smoke coming from a drain cover in northampton town centre this morning .
they were called to the derngate and guildhall road area just before 07:00 .
western power distribution said there was no fire but smoke was caused by an underground electrical fault .
about 20 properties have had their electricity cut off while repairs are carried out under a pavement .
a spokesman said it hopes to have power fully restored by 14:00 .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: pedestrian hit by car driven in circles by 'man wielding baseball bat '
text: police want to hear from anyone who saw a car being driven `` dangerously '' around kettering town centre at about 04:00 on saturday morning .
a man , believed to be carrying a baseball bat , allegedly got into a blue ford focus and drove around in circles in the horse market area .
a pedestrian was knocked to the floor and the car was then driven off along london road .
they were unhurt .
the driver was described as black , aged 20 to 25 , and he wore a light grey jacket and a black shirt .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: why are the a6 repairs taking so long ?
text: the a6 is one of northamptonshire 's major roads and a busy section of it has been closed for nearly six months .
it wo n't reopen until the end of august .
the official diversion route is via the a14 , a43 , a6003 and a427 , but people in rothwell and desborough have told us many drivers - including lorries - are using their towns as a shortcut .
engineers have finished working on one of the two bridges that needed urgent repairs , excavating to shore up its foundations , but they 're only just starting work on a second bridge .
northamptonshire highways spokeswoman , rebecca miller , said : `` because we are working next to the midland mainline , network rail and northamptonshire highways have had to liaise closely .
`` we could n't work next to a live railway and excavate in the same way as we did on the first bridge .
we had to look for other options and get the necessary permits and licences . ''
the final cost of repairs and whether or not central government will foot the bill are not yet known .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: repairs begin on second a6 bridge
text: the next phase of emergency repairs on the a6 begins today .
part of the rothwell and desborough bypass has been closed since 18 january when gaps were found under the road surface during a routine inspection .
engineers have finished shoring up the foundations of a bridge which crosses the river ise .
now they 're moving on to repairs to a nearby railway bridge .
the latest estimate for the full reopening of the road is the end of august .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: cricket : kent v northants
text: northants ' head coach david ripley says he 's hoping his side can feed off some good memories against kent at beckenham today , as they begin a big week in division two of the county championship .
northants are fourth in the table - seven points behind kent and 20 adrift of second-placed worcester , with a game in hand .
we 've played well against kent in recent times .
they 're a good side .
they 've got a couple of oversees options , which will be interesting .
but we 're playing well and we 're looking forward to it . ''
we will have full commentary from 11:00 .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northamptonshire needs nurses
text: a campaign 's been launched to recruit more nursing staff in northamptonshire .
it comes as we hear today that more nurses and midwives are leaving the profession in the uk than joining it , according to new figures .
the royal college of nursing ( rcn ) said poor working conditions and the `` vicious cycle '' of staffing levels had contributed to the number of nurses leaving the profession .

the local recruitment campaign is being run by northampton and kettering general hospitals , st andrew 's hospital in northampton , northamptonshire healthcare foundation trust and the university of northampton .
they 've teamed up to launch a new website to sell the county as a great place to live and work .
at the moment , kettering general has 50 nursing vacancies , northampton general has 150 and st andrew 's says it needs to recruit 130 nurses annually .
the university 's role will be to attract more lecturers and students on to its nursing courses .
steve o'brien , the head of the faculty of health , said : `` nursing can be a fantastic career for people .
`` it opens up all sorts of opportunities to work in a whole range of places - not just in hospitals but in the community . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cloudy with showers in the afternoon
text: a cloudy start to the day for many places with rain expected during the afternoon .
showers will give way to warm evening sunshine .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f )
more details from bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome !
it 's monday , 3 july , and we 're back with another week of live updates for northamptonshire .
we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , weather and travel between now and 18:00 .
first up , a full weather forecast is on the way .
you can get in touch by email , twitter or facebook .
